thread.title: Pedestrian hit, pinned up against supermarket in New Plymouth | Stuff.co.nz
thread.title_full: Pedestrian hit, pinned up against supermarket in New Plymouth | Stuff.co.nz

author: Jeremy Wilkinson
title: Pedestrian hit, pinned up against supermarket in New Plymouth | Stuff.co.nz
text:
Pedestrian hit, pinned up against supermarket in New Plymouth JEREMY WILKINSON Last updated 15:05, February 18 2017 SUPPLIED 
Staff members clean up after a car went through the front window of Countdown in The Valley, New Plymouth. 
A pedestrian has escaped with minor injuries after a car mounted a footpath before pinning them against a supermarket in New Plymouth. 
Police were called to Countdown at The Valley shopping centre at 10.54am on Saturday where the driver car had hit the pedestrian, a police spokesperson said. 
Do you know the victim of this incident? Email 
"The car has gone onto the footpath where the victim has been in between the car and the window," they said. 
The victim had minor injuries and was taken to hospital for observation and the incident was still under investigation. 
READ MORE: * Pedestrian hurled through store front window after being hit by van 
The supermarket's lower windows were smashed in and staff were busy cleaning up broken glass several hours later. 
Manager Tony Perry said he thought the driver of the car might have got confused between drive and reverse. 
"A man was in between the car and window, but he was mostly fine I think," he said. 
"This doesn't happen often, thank goodness, we wouldn't too many of these." - Stuff
